label: AB6C_hR8_148_a_f_b-001
title: $\beta$-CuZrF$_{6}$ Structure
comments:
CuZrF$_{6}$ exists in four forms, depending on the temperature. Structures below 500K show evidence of a Jahn-Teller distortion. \begin{itemize} \item \href{current_web_home_dir/AB6C_cF32_225_a_e_b-001}{$\alpha'$-CuZrF$_{6}$} is the high temperature cubic form.  Evidence from (Propach, 1978) shows this to be stable above $\approx 450$K.  We use the lattice constant at 500K. \item \href{current_web_home_dir/AB12C_cF56_202_a_h_b-001}{$\alpha$-CuZrF$_{6}$} is stable above 383K.  The fluorine (6f) sites are doubled, with only one of each pair occupied. We use data taken at 393K. \item \href{current_web_home_dir/AB6C_hR8_148_a_f_b-001}{$\beta$-CuZrF$_{6}$} (this structure) is stable between 353 and 383K. In this case the Jahn-Teller distortion is locked in, so there are only six fluorine sites, all fully occupied. \item \href{current_web_home_dir/AB12C_aP14_2_b_6i_c-001}{$\gamma$-CuZrF$_{6}$} is stable below 353K.  Again each fluorine site is only half-filled. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 Hexagonal settings of this structure can be obtained with the option {\tt --hex}.
